inlineContent.text: ethical considerations in AI image generation.
User data is not stored on Apple servers.
designed with privacy at the center.
: Most AI computation happens on the device
: Only necessary minimum information is processed
: Users can understand how data is processed
and reflect them in app design.
person image features in your app.
There are strict restrictions on using
Only people the user directly selects from People album can be used
Programmatic injection of faces is not possible
Generated images are stylized to not look like real people

Do not generate unauthorized images of real people

It’s important to clearly inform users
Provide explanations about the generation process
Do not generate images without user consent
Measures to prevent misuse of generated content
responsible use is up to developers and users.

What is the core way Apple Intelligence
Performing most AI processing directly on the device (on-device)

Apple does not store user data
Only collecting anonymized data for AI training
Why is person image usage restricted
Because facial recognition is technically difficult
Facial recognition is possible with Apple’s technology,
but it’s restricted for ethical reasons.
An ethical decision to prevent deepfake abuse and privacy violations
Due to photo library access permission issues

Technical specifications of the model used for image generation
Clearly indicate it’s AI-generated content and provide usage guidelines

Not generating images without user consent
Explicit consent is a basic requirement.
